basic.description: Electromagnetic theory and applications. Topics include: Maxwell's equations, gauge theory, relativistic transformations of Maxwell's equations, properties of waves in free space, dielectrics, conductors and ionized media, reflection and refraction at the surfaces of various media, propagation in metallic and dielectric waveguides, radiation of electromagnetic waves from charged particles and antennae.
basic.subject: PHYS
basic.title: Electromagnetic Theory

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisites     PHYS239 and (MATH221 or MATH280) and (MATH232 or MATH231).
Equivalency    PHYS332.
